info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 7:20PM CDT until October 24 at 10:15PM CDT by NWS San Angelo TX
info.description:
* WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of west central Texas, including the following counties, Schleicher and Sutton.
* WHEN...Until 1015 PM CDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 717 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms from Eldorado to Sonora...moving east at 35 mph. Additional storms in southeast Crockett county will also move into western Sutton county, moving east along I-10 and move into Sonora. These could produce 1 to 3 inches of additional rainfall. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1.25 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 3 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Sonora, Eldorado, Us-277 Near The Sutton-Schleicher County Line, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2596 And Ranch Road 864, The Intersection Of I-10 And Ranch Road 1989, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 2084, The Intersection Of Ranch Road 1828 And Ranch Road 915, The Intersection Of Us-277 And Ranch Road 189, The Intersection Of Us-190 And Ranch Road 1828, Adams, I-10 Near The Sutton-Kimble County Line and Us-190 Near The Crockett-Sutton County Line. - People attending Eldorado Larry Mitchell Stadium should seek shelter immediately.
This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 380 and 433.
This includes the following Low Water Crossings... River Road crossing North Llano River. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1015 PM CDT THIS EVENING
